RE: License #: CI630201167
Dear Ms. Miller:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
01/12/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Kari Muntean, at 734-395-0920.
Sincerely,
Vivian Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all of the following
information shall be documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom the resident was
discharged.
One of two closed youth files reviewed did not state the name and
official title to whom youth was discharged.
CCI Rule 400.4146 Immunizations.
(1) A resident shall have current immunizations as required by the
department of community health.
Two of three open youth files reviewed did not have complete
immunizations. One youth’s Meningococcal Conjugate was overdue on
08/24/2020 and his Tdap was overdue on 08/24/2020. The other youth’s
Meningococcal Conjugate was overdue on 07/22/2021 and his
Meningococcal B Category B was overdue on 08/22/2020.
CCI Rule 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(4) Training opportunities for direct care staff shall include, but are not
limited to, all of the following:
(h) First aid.
Two of three new employee files reviewed did not have first aid training
in the past year.
Three of three existing employee files reviewed did not have first aid
training in the past year.

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
• RFCAN Contract: Service plans shall be completed on the age appropriate
Children’s Foster Care Residential Updated Service Plan (DHHS 366).
One of seven Updated Service Plans reviewed was completed on the wrong
DHHS 366 form. This youth turned 14 years old in 08/2022 and his Updated
Service Plan for period 09/30/2022 to 12/29/2022 was completed on the DHHS
366 A form, which is for youth 10 to 13 years old. The DHHS 366 B form is to
be used for a youth 14 years old and older.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency submitted 3 acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment in care during this licensing period.
• December 2021 Renewal inspection report
R 400.4113 Central registry was cited. This issue is resolved because it is not
a repeat violation in this inspection report.
• 2021C0325041
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff and R 400.4109 Program statement were
cited. The agency’s corrective action plan was monitored by a Department of
Child Welfare Licensing consultant for six months and found compliance in
training all staff and staff adhering to the sexual acting out precaution policy
and procedure, level of monitoring policy and procedure, morning and
bedtime policy and procedure and line of sight policy and procedure.
2

• 2022C0325006
R 400.4109 Program statement was cited. The agency’s corrective action
plan was monitored by a Department of Child Welfare Licensing consultant
for six months and found in compliance in training all staff and staff adhering
to the revised morning and bedtime policy and procedure and line of sight
policy and procedure. This corrective action plan is similar to 2021C0325006
corrective action plan due to the nature and timing of the investigations.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue their regular license.
